conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> I want to start the negotiation by proposing a trade that allows me to recover at least the production cost of the resource. I will propose a higher amount initially to leave room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 5000 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have a high-quality resource that I believe will be very valuable to you. Considering the production costs and its value, I propose a trade where I give you one unit of resource X in exchange for 5000 ZUP. Let's negotiate a deal that works for both of us. </message>

<other player message> I understand the value of your high-quality resource, but I would like to propose a trade of 4500 ZUP for one unit of resource X. This better aligns with my budget while still offering you a fair price for your costs and the resource's worth. Let's find a middle ground that works for both of us. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 4500 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> The counteroffer from Player BLUE is less than my initial asking price but still above my production costs. I will counter with a slightly reduced amount to come closer to a middle ground, while still aiming for a profit margin. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 4800 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your offer and understand your budget considerations. However, to better reflect the value of the resource and the costs involved in its production, I propose a revised trade of 4800 ZUP for one unit of resource X. This should provide a fair balance between your budget and the value I'm offering. Let's work towards a mutually beneficial agreement. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for considering my budget. I propose a counteroffer of 4700 ZUP for one unit of resource X, which I believe is a fair compromise for both of us, considering the value you provide and my financial constraints. Let's close in on a deal that is mutually satisfactory. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 4700 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 3 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 4000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has come up in price, showing a willingness to negotiate and meet my desired selling price. Their offer of 4700 ZUP is very close to my last proposal and still provides me with a reasonable profit margin. It's important to keep the negotiation momentum going and be willing to concede slightly to secure the deal. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I am pleased with your counteroffer of 4700 ZUP for one unit of resource X. It's a fair compromise, reflecting both the quality of the resource and respect for your budget. Let's proceed with this deal. </message>
